title: 1987–1989 FIRA Trophy
text:
The 1987–89 FIRA Trophy was the 27th edition of a European <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> championship for national teams. It was played along two seasons (1987–1988 and 1988–89).
The tournament was won by <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">France</a>, with a single loss to <a href="Soviet%20Union%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Soviet Union</a> (17–10) in <a href="Kutaisi">Kutaisi</a>. Despite facing strong opposition from both <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy</a> and <a href="Soviet%20Union%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Soviet Union</a>, the French only awarded caps in their games with <a href="Romania%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Romania</a>, who finished in 3rd place, while the Soviets reached the 2nd place. <a href="Spain%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Spain</a> lost all their matches and were relegated.
The winners of the Second division two pools were <a href="Poland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Poland</a> and <a href="Belgium%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Belgium</a>, who faced each other in a final, with the Poles winning (25–23).
